meanings.sent1: She oppugned the idea of raising taxes.
meanings.sent2: The soldiers oppugned the enemy's stronghold.
meanings.sent3: The cat oppugned the vacuum cleaner, thinking it was a threat.
meanings.sent4: His arguments oppugned the very foundation of their beliefs.
meanings.sent5: The waves oppugned the shore relentlessly, eroding it over time.

meanings.definition: The act of opposing or attacking
meanings.sent1: The oppugning of the new policy caused a stir among the employees.
meanings.sent2: He witnessed the fierce oppugning between the rival factions.
meanings.sent3: The oppugning of the squirrel against the bird feeder was a sight to behold.
meanings.sent4: The oppugning of corruption in the government was long overdue.
meanings.sent5: The oppugning of the fortress was met with fierce resistance from the defenders.
